attributes.action: Introduce sanctions for MPs that jeer and shout in the House of Commons
attributes.background: There is no need for our politicians to jeer and heckle their colleagues in the House of Commons. It is childish, sets a bad example for how people should conduct themselves and cannot be conducive to making sound and rational decisions for the country. It is, quite frankly, embarrassing.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because there are already sanctions available to the Speaker and his deputies if MPs act in a disorderly way. These include being able to suspend MPs for a set period of time. We are therefore not sure what further action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take.
